response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (18 years)", "high", "Being very young is associated with higher recidivism, as younger offenders tend to have a longer period of risk and may be more susceptible to risky behavior."],
    ["Gender (female)", "low", "Females generally have lower rates of recidivism compared to males."],
    ["Race (White)", "medium", "White individuals typically exhibit moderate risk profiles, though this factor interacts with other variables."],
    ["Criminal history (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A single arrest without conviction indicates some history with the justice system but may not be strongly predictive of future recidivism on its own."],
    ["Employment (5 jobs during the year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes may indicate instability or economic stress, which can increase risk."],
    ["Drug use (marijuana and cocaine in past four years)", "high", "Recent use of drugs, including cocaine, is a significant risk factor for recidivism due to its association with continued substance abuse and related criminal behavior."],
    ["Mental health (feeling down some of the time in the past month)", "medium", "Experience of depressive symptoms can undermine judgment and stability, contributing to risk."],
    ["Living situation (living alone)", "medium", "Living alone can reduce social support, potentially increasing vulnerability to stress and recidivism."],
    ["Education (enrolled in school)", "low", "Being in school is a protective factor as it offers structure and a pathway for future opportunities."],
    ["Religious belief (considers God has nothing to do with her life)", "medium", "Lack of religious involvement can reduce access to certain community supports and a moral framework that some studies find protective."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being very young is associated with higher recidivism, as younger offenders tend to have a longer period of risk and may be more susceptible to risky behavior.
Females generally have lower rates of recidivism compared to males.
White individuals typically exhibit moderate risk profiles, though this factor interacts with other variables.
A single arrest without conviction indicates some history with the justice system but may not be strongly predictive of future recidivism on its own.
Frequent job changes may indicate instability or economic stress, which can increase risk.
Drug use (marijuana and cocaine in past four years)
Recent use of drugs, including cocaine, is a significant risk factor for recidivism due to its association with continued substance abuse and related criminal behavior.
Mental health (feeling down some of the time in the past month)
Experience of depressive symptoms can undermine judgment and stability, contributing to risk.
Living alone can reduce social support, potentially increasing vulnerability to stress and recidivism.
Being in school is a protective factor as it offers structure and a pathway for future opportunities.
Religious belief (considers God has nothing to do with her life)
Lack of religious involvement can reduce access to certain community supports and a moral framework that some studies find protective.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. She is 5 feet 2 inches and weighs 113 lbs. She has never been married and is currently living alone. She is enrolled in school at the present moment. She has held 5 jobs during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month she has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer her up. At a young age, she lived with her biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. She considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
